info.title: Katsu Metadata Service API
info.description: A metadata service for clinical/phenotypical and experiment metadata

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

id.description: Unique arbitrary, researcher-specified identifier for the biosample.

description.description: Human-readable, unstructured text describing the biosample or providing additional information.

sampled_tissue.description: An ontology term describing the tissue from which the specimen was collected. The use of UBERON is recommended.

taxonomy.description: An ontology term specified when more than one organism may be studied. It is advised that codesfrom the NCBI Taxonomy resource are used, e.g. NCBITaxon:9606 for humans.

histological_diagnosis.description: An ontology term representing a refinement of the clinical diagnosis. Normal samples could be tagged with NCIT:C38757, representing a negative finding.

tumor_progression.description: An ontology term representing if the specimen is from a primary tumour, a metastasis, or a recurrence. There are multiple ways of representing this using ontology terms, and the terms chosen will have a specific meaning that is application specific.

tumor_grade.description: An ontology term representing the tumour grade. This should be a child term of NCIT:C28076 (Disease Grade Qualifier) or equivalent.

diagnostic_markers.description: A list of ontology terms representing clinically-relevant bio-markers.

is_control_sample.description: Whether the sample is being used as a normal control.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

individual.description: Identifier for the individual this biosample was sampled from.

hts_files.description: A list of HTS files derived from the biosample.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

id.description: An arbitrary identifier for the cancer condition.

condition_type.description: Cancer condition type: primary or secondary.

body_site.description: Code for the body location, optionally pre-coordinating laterality or direction. Accepted ontologies: SNOMED CT, ICD-O-3 and others.

laterality.description: Body side of the body location, if needed to distinguish from a similar location on the other side of the body.

clinical_status.description: A flag indicating whether the condition is active or inactive, recurring, in remission, or resolved (as of the last update of the Condition). Accepted code system: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-clinical

code.description: A code describing the type of primary or secondary malignant neoplastic disease.

date_of_diagnosis.description: The date the disease was first clinically recognized with sufficient certainty, regardless of whether it was fully characterized at that time.

histology_morphology_behavior.description: A description of the morphologic and behavioral characteristics of the cancer. Accepted ontologies: SNOMED CT, ICD-O-3 and others.

verification_status.description: A flag indicating whether the condition is unconfirmed, provisional, differential, confirmed, refuted, or entered-in-error.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

id.description: An arbitrary identifier for the cancer genetic variant.

data_value.description: The overall result of the genetic test; specifically, whether a variant is present, absent, no call, or indeterminant.

method.description: The method used to perform the genetic test.

amino_acid_change.description: The symbolic representation of an amino acid variant reported using HGVS nomenclature (pHGVS).

amino_acid_change_type.description: The type of change related to the amino acid variant.

cytogenetic_nomenclature.description: The cytogenetic (chromosome) location, represented using the International System for Human Cytogenetic Nomenclature (ISCN).

genomic_dna_change.description: The symbolic representation of a genetic structural variant reported using HGVS nomenclature (gHGVS).

genomic_source_class.description: The genomic class of the specimen being analyzed, for example, germline for inherited genome, somatic for cancer genome, and prenatal for fetal genome.

variation_code.description: The variation ID assigned by ClinVar.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

gene_studied.description: A gene targeted for mutation analysis, identified in HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) notation.

id.description: An arbitrary identifier for the procedure.

procedure_type.description: Type of cancer related procedure: radiation or surgical.

body_site.description: The body location(s) where the procedure was performed.

laterality.description: Body side of the body location, if needed to distinguish from a similar location on the other side of the body.

reason_code.description: The explanation or justification for why the surgical procedure was performed.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

reason_reference.description: Reference to a primary or secondary cancer condition.

get.description: Chord phenopacket schema that can be shared with data providers.
get.summary: Chord phenopacket schema that can be shared with data providers.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

linked_field_sets.description: Data type fields which are linked together.

dates.description: Relevant dates for the datasets, a date must be added, e.g. creation date or last modification date should be added.

stored_in.description: The data repository hosting the dataset.

spatial_coverage.description: The geographical extension and span covered by the dataset and its measured dimensions/variables.

types.description: A term, ideally from a controlled terminology, identifying the dataset type or nature of the data, placing it in a typology.

availability.description: A qualifier indicating the different types of availability for a dataset (available, unavailable, embargoed, available with restriction, information not available).

refinement.description: A qualifier to describe the level of data processing of the dataset and its distributions.

aggregation.description: A qualifier indicating if the entity represents an 'instance of dataset' or a 'collection of datasets'.

privacy.description: A qualifier to describe the data protection applied to the dataset. This is relevant for clinical data.

distributions.description: The distribution(s) by which datasets are made available (for example: mySQL dump).

dimensions.description: The different dimensions (granular components) making up a dataset.

primary_publications.description: The primary publication(s) associated with the dataset, usually describing how the dataset was produced.

citations.description: The publication(s) that cite this dataset.

citation_count.description: The number of publications that cite this dataset (enumerated in the citations property).

produced_by.description: A study process which generated a given dataset, if any.

creators.description: The person(s) or organization(s) which contributed to the creation of the dataset.

licenses.description: The terms of use of the dataset.

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the work reported by the dataset.

keywords.description: Tags associated with the dataset, which will help in its discovery.

version.description: A release point for the dataset when applicable.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.

additional_resources.description: Any resource objects linked to this dataset that aren't specified by a phenopacket in the dataset.

has_part.description: A Dataset that is a subset of this Dataset; Datasets declaring the 'hasPart' relationship are considered a collection of Datasets, the aggregation criteria could be included in the 'description' field.

parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this dataset.

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

term.description: An ontology term that represents the disease. It's recommended that one of the OMIM, Orphanet, or MONDO ontologies is used for rare human diseases.

onset.description: A representation of the age of onset of the disease

disease_stage.description: A list of terms representing the disease stage. Elements should be derived from child terms of NCIT:C28108 (Disease Stage Qualifier) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

tnm_finding.description: A list of terms representing the tumour TNM score. Elements should be derived from child terms of NCIT:C48232 (Cancer TNM Finding) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

identifier.description: An arbitrary identifier for an experiment result.

filename.description: The name of the file containing the result.

data_output_type.description: The type of data output: Raw or Derived data.Raw data - the data output type that can be converted back to the original result set. Derived data - the data output type that cannot be converted back to the original result set.

usage.description: Internal to the Bento: describe how data is used within Bento (visualized or can be downloaded).

creation_date.description: The date when the experiment result file was created.

created_by.description: Name/Username/Code of the person who prepared the sequencing data.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

parameters.description: A unique integer value identifying this experiment result.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique integer value identifying this experiment result.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

id.description: An arbitrary identifier for the experiment.

study_type.description: Which study type the experiment belongs to.E.g. Epigenomics, Proteomics, Metagenomics, Transcriptomics, Metabolomics.

experiment_type.description: (Controlled Vocabulary) The assay target (e.g. DNA Methylation, mRNA-Seq, smRNA-Seq, Histone H3K4me1, etc.).

experiment_ontology.description: Links to experiment ontology information (e.g. via the OBI ontology.).

molecule.description: (Controlled Vocabulary) The type of molecule that was extracted from the biological material.Include one of the following: total RNA, polyA RNA, cytoplasmic RNA, nuclear RNA, small RNA, genomic DNA, protein, or other.

molecule_ontology.description: Links to molecule ontology information (e.g. via the SO ontology.).

library_strategy.description: (Controlled Vocabulary) The assay used. These are defined within the SRA metadata specifications with a controlled vocabulary (e.g. Bisulfite-Seq, RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq). For a complete list, see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/submit/reads-library-strategy.

library_source.description: The type of source material that is being sequenced. E.g. Genomic, Genomic Single Cell,Transcriptomic, Transcriptomic Single Cell, Metagenomic, Metatranscriptomic, Synthetic,Viral RNA, Other.

library_selection.description: Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation. E.g. Random, PCR, Random PCR, RT-PCR, MF and other.

library_layout.description: The library layout. E.g. Single, Paired.

extraction_protocol.description: The protocol used to isolate the extract material.

reference_registry_id.description: The IHEC EpiRR ID for this dataset, only for IHEC Reference Epigenome datasets. Otherwise leave empty.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

biosample.description: Biosample on which this experiment was done.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An arbitrary identifier for the experiment.

experiment_ontology.description: Links to experiment ontology information (e.g. via the OBI ontology.).

molecule.description: (Controlled Vocabulary) The type of molecule that was extracted from the biological material.Include one of the following: total RNA, polyA RNA, cytoplasmic RNA, nuclear RNA, small RNA, genomic DNA, protein, or other.

molecule_ontology.description: Links to molecule ontology information (e.g. via the SO ontology.).

library_strategy.description: (Controlled Vocabulary) The assay used. These are defined within the SRA metadata specifications with a controlled vocabulary (e.g. Bisulfite-Seq, RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq). For a complete list, see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/submit/reads-library-strategy.

library_source.description: The type of source material that is being sequenced. E.g. Genomic, Genomic Single Cell,Transcriptomic, Transcriptomic Single Cell, Metagenomic, Metatranscriptomic, Synthetic,Viral RNA, Other.

library_selection.description: Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation. E.g. Random, PCR, Random PCR, RT-PCR, MF and other.

library_layout.description: The library layout. E.g. Single, Paired.

extraction_protocol.description: The protocol used to isolate the extract material.

reference_registry_id.description: The IHEC EpiRR ID for this dataset, only for IHEC Reference Epigenome datasets. Otherwise leave empty.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

biosample.description: Biosample on which this experiment was done.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An arbitrary identifier for the experiment.

id.description: An arbitrary identifier for the experiment.

study_type.description: Which study type the experiment belongs to.E.g. Epigenomics, Proteomics, Metagenomics, Transcriptomics, Metabolomics.

experiment_type.description: (Controlled Vocabulary) The assay target (e.g. DNA Methylation, mRNA-Seq, smRNA-Seq, Histone H3K4me1, etc.).

experiment_ontology.description: Links to experiment ontology information (e.g. via the OBI ontology.).

molecule.description: (Controlled Vocabulary) The type of molecule that was extracted from the biological material.Include one of the following: total RNA, polyA RNA, cytoplasmic RNA, nuclear RNA, small RNA, genomic DNA, protein, or other.

molecule_ontology.description: Links to molecule ontology information (e.g. via the SO ontology.).

library_strategy.description: (Controlled Vocabulary) The assay used. These are defined within the SRA metadata specifications with a controlled vocabulary (e.g. Bisulfite-Seq, RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq). For a complete list, see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/submit/reads-library-strategy.

library_source.description: The type of source material that is being sequenced. E.g. Genomic, Genomic Single Cell,Transcriptomic, Transcriptomic Single Cell, Metagenomic, Metatranscriptomic, Synthetic,Viral RNA, Other.

library_selection.description: Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation. E.g. Random, PCR, Random PCR, RT-PCR, MF and other.

library_layout.description: The library layout. E.g. Single, Paired.

extraction_protocol.description: The protocol used to isolate the extract material.

reference_registry_id.description: The IHEC EpiRR ID for this dataset, only for IHEC Reference Epigenome datasets. Otherwise leave empty.

description.description: Human-readable text describing the phenotypic feature; NOT for structured text.

negated.description: Whether the feature is present (false) or absent (true, feature is negated); default is false.

severity.description: An ontology term that describes the severity of the condition.

modifier.description: A list of ontology terms that provide more expressive / precise descriptions of a phenotypic feature, including e.g. positionality or external factors.

onset.description: An ontology term that describes the age at which the phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed, e.g. HP:0003674.

evidence.description: One or more pieces of evidence that specify how the phenotype was determined.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

id.description: For OBO ontologies, the value of this string MUST always be the official OBO ID, which is always equivalent to the ID prefix in lower case. For other resources use the prefix in identifiers.org.

name.description: The full name of the resource or ontology referred to by the id element.

namespace_prefix.description: Prefix for objects from this resource. In the case of ontology resources, this should be the CURIE prefix.

url.description: Resource URL. In the case of ontologies, this should be an OBO or OWL file. Other resources should link to the official or top-level url.

version.description: The version of the resource or ontology used to make the annotation.

iri_prefix.description: The IRI prefix, when used with the namespace prefix and an object ID, should resolve the term or object from the resource in question.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

id.description: An arbitrary identifier for the TNM staging.

stage_group.description: The extent of the cancer in the body, according to the TNM classification system.Accepted ontologies: SNOMED CT, AJCC and others.

primary_tumor_category.description: Category of the primary tumor, based on its size and extent. Accepted ontologies: SNOMED CT, AJCC and others.

regional_nodes_category.description: Category of the presence or absence of metastases in regional lymph nodes. Accepted ontologies: SNOMED CT, AJCC and others.

distant_metastases_category.description: Category describing the presence or absence of metastases in remote anatomical locations. Accepted ontologies: SNOMED CT, AJCC and others.

extra_properties.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

post.description:
Export data from Katsu

Exports the requested data object (e.g. a Dataset or a Project) in the given
format.
Note that the generated files will be either written locally if a path is
provided, or downloaded as a tar gzipped attachment otherwise.
